title: The Benn Act was idiotic and self-lacerating
text:
Boris Johnson shared his Brexit plan with the Commons yesterday and the tone of debate was calm – largely because the Speaker had a frog in his throat. Unable to waffle and harass MPs in his usual, florid style, John Bercow was forced to do his job and simply call on them to speak. The relative civility of proceedings suggests that a lot of the anger in Parliament – something about which Mr Bercow loves to give long speeches – emanates from him. The sooner he goes, the better.

Labour unsurprisingly opposed everything the PM said. More significant were the positive noises from Eurosceptics: the most striking effect of Mr Johnson’s constructive offer to the EU has been to unite Leave-in-Parliament....
